work.name: Data and Analytic Services, BC Centre for Disease Control
work.position: Data Scientist w/ Lisa Y.W. Tang
work.summary: Developed data-driven systems to collect, analyze, and visualize misinformation patterns from social media for public health surveillance.
highlights: Built an automated web-scraping pipeline (Python, Selenium) to collect location- and keyword-specific posts from Instagram and X on a daily basis, with caching, rate-limit handling, and text parsing.
Cleaned and processed 5,000+ social media posts, creating geospatial visualizations of misinformation patterns for public health surveillance.
Designed and evaluated misinformation classification systems using open-source LLMs and traditional ML models, benchmarking multiple preprocessing strategies.
Delivered findings to supervisors and policymakers through reports and presentations, supporting data-driven decision making.

work.name: Dynamic Brain Circuits in Health and Disease Cluster, Djavad Mowafaghian Centre for Brain Health, University of British Columbia
work.position: Neuroscience Open Science Specialist w/ Jeffrey LeDue & Timothy H. Murphy
work.summary: Supported neuroscience research by developing data infrastructure, automation tools, and reproducible workflows for multiple labs and institutional projects.
highlights: Automated data ingestion by scraping 200+ neuroscience events with Python/BeautifulSoup to update a widely used research website.
Developed Python and Jupyter-based tools for image processing, vision tracking, and data parsing, supporting multiple neuroscience labs.
Created a collaboration visualization tool in Python/Jupyter that generated figures for organizational reviews and remains in active use.
Improved reproducibility infrastructure by migrating projects into Apptainer containers, documenting workflows, and training researchers on GitHub and OSF.
